name: Satwik Patnaik
content: Satwik PatnaikSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationSatwik PatnaikAssistant ProfessorDepartment of Electrical and Computer EngineeringDepartment of Computer and Information Sciences (Joint)University of DelawareNewark, Delaware, USAContactEmail: satwik@udel.eduI am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Delaware, Newark, DE, USA.  The goal of my research encompasses strengthening the security of the globalized semiconductor supply chain and developing security-focused CAD tools and methodologies to realize secure and trustworthy hardware and systems. A detailed biography can be found here.Research InterestsHardware Security, Computer SecuritySecure Computer-Aided Design ToolsReinforcement Learning (RL) and Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) for SecurityHardware Intellectual Property Protection, Hardware Trojans, Side-channel AttacksHeterogenous Integration and Emerging Technologies for SecurityEducationPh.D. in Electrical Engineering, Tandon School of Engineering, New York University, USA (2015 – 2020)M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Specialization in VLSI Design), Indian Institute of Information Technology & Management, India (2011 – 2013)B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering, University of Pune, India (2006 – 2010)Work ExperienceAssistant Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Delaware (August 2023 -- Present)Postdoctoral Researcher, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Texas A&M University (October 2020 – July 2023)Graduate Research Assistant,
